metadata.title: CVE-2019-11884 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The do_hidp_sock_ioctl function in net/bluetooth/hidp/sock.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.0.15 allows a local user to obtain potentially sensitiveinformation from kernel stack memory via a HIDPCONNADD command, because aname field may not end with a '\0' character.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
